bug.short_desc: [Sync View] SaveableCompareEditorInput as API

long_desc.thetext: LocalResourceTypedElement has some complicated logic for enabling a direct save when content viewers are flushed and for file buffer support. It would be good if this class was API. However, before we do so, we need to work out the difference between flushing and saving. At the current time, if file buffers are being used, the element will save to disk but if file buffers are not used, the element will buffer the contents and clients (i.e. the containing compare editor input) must provide the logic for saving the element contents to disk. It wouldbe good if we could simplify this before making the class API.

I just ran into a related problem. I was trying to throw a content change when the file buffer for a local typed element was saved and that resulted in a stack overflow because he wrapping compare input listens to content change events to know if it needs to save. I think it would be better to have the typed element perform the save and then fire the change events. We would still need special handling for an editor save but all the logic could be contained in the local resource typed element.

I've taken a different approach and released a savealeCompareEditorInput as API. The editor input provides a fiel-based type element for the left contributor and handles the save lifecycle. It also should work with other types of saveables.
Verified in I20061031-0656

bug.short_desc: Allow 'Command line pattern' field not to be shown in Tool Settings page.

long_desc.thetext: When selecting a tool in the project properties->C/C++ Buil->Tool Settings tab, the page shows an 'Expert settings:' label with a 'Command line pattern' edit field. It is however possible to use a specific command line generator that does not use these patterns, in that case it would be preferred if the edit field and consequently the 'Expert settings' field won't be shown at all.

bug.short_desc: [Layout] Arrange all on logic diagram with a single figure causes figure to move incorrectly

long_desc.thetext:
To reproduce: 1. Create a new logic diagram 2. Create a circuit on the diagram 3. Right click on the diagram select arrange all
Expected result: When arrange all is executed with a single shape on the diagram, the shape should move to the top left corner of the diagram.
Actual result: The shape shifts down and to the right. Selecting arrange all multiple times will continue to shift the shape. If this is done enough times, the shape will eventually leave the viewport.
Regression.
Moving to the next release, GMF 2.1.

bug.short_desc: [Layout] Arrange all incorrectly arranges diagram with connections connecting shapes from inside one container to another

long_desc.thetext:
1- Create a Logic diagram 2- Add a circuit; make it big enough to hold 1 Oval inside it 3- Copy the circuit and paste it twice 3- Move the Circuits so they do not overlap 4- Add an Oval inside each Circuit 5- Connect the Oval inside Circuit 1 to the oval inside Circuit 2 (the order here is important) 5- Connect the Oval inside Circuit 2 to the oval inside Circuit 3 (the order here is important) 5- Connect the Oval inside Circuit 3 to the oval inside Circuit 1 (the order here is important) 7- Right click on the diagram and select arrange all
Expected result: Diagram is arranged properly. Connections do not overlap. Actual result: In certain cases the diagram is incorrectly arranged and the connections between ovals overlap.
Created an attachment (id=52222) Expected results
Created an attachment (id=52223) Actual results
Regression
Moving to the next release, GMF 2.1.

bug.short_desc: [index] "Open Type" function often fails to find types

long_desc.thetext:
Since I upgraded to 3.2 I've been sporadically having problems with the "Open Type" function. I'll attach a screenshot showing Java files that I found with the find in files, but that are not showing up when I do "Open Type". I have this happen relatively often, but less than half of the time.
I find this very frustrating, because we have thousands and thousands of class files, and this was how I always found what I was looking for, and it no longer works reliably.
I know this isn't the forum for this, but I've been a bit frustrated by the "two steps forward, one step back" that eclipse always seems to do when I upgrade, even with final, stable builds.

There is another, similarly frustrating behavior: sometimes in the class hierarchy, child classes are missing. This is really dangerous, because often one needs to make a change to a parent class and all child classes. When some of them hide, they don't get updated, and the result is bugs in my code.
Also, the references in workspace search for a type sometimes returns nothing when it should return something.
Created an attachment (id=52226) screenshot showing files found by find-in-files, but type is not found
It sounds to be a problem with indexes. Do you have anything in the .log?

Unfortunately I don't see anything interesting in the log.
I also tried exiting, deleting the log, launching eclipse, cleaning all projects, then finding the type (still not found), but nothing relevant in the log

Hmm, then it will be dificult to understand what happen there... One thing to verify that it comes from indexes (and also may be to workaround your problem), can you please, shutdown your eclipse session, delete all files in .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core sub-directory of your workspace and restart eclipse, then try to reopen the Open Type dialog...
If problem is still there after indexing finished, then it's something else but if you got back types correctly, this would confirm that your indexes were corrupted...
Exiting, deleting everything in .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.core, then restarting - that fixed the problem. I now see the classes that were being hidden before.

Next step will be now to reopen this bug and attach .log file *as soon as* you get this problem again. As this is an indexing issue which runs in background, problem may have occurred some times ago when you see it in Open Type dialog or while performing a search request. I need to get log rapidly, hoping the reason of the crash will have been logged there and won't have been reset since it occurred. Then perhaps, this will give me some clue to understand what happened... Thanks

I'm having the same problem under 3.3M4, Windows.
I don't even have an error log generated to attach (no errors). Deleting org.eclipse.jdt.core from .metadata\.plugins didn't help, either. I was even able to reproduce the problem in a new workspace.
I'll find a one or more milestones of 3.3 to test, just to make sure this was fixed, and new to 3.3M4.

bug.short_desc: [hotbug] [WSDL4J] org.wsdl4j plugin uses obsolete WSDL MIME binding schema

long_desc.thetext:
The org.wsdl4j plugin uses an old version of the WSDL MIME bindings schema. This causes the WSDL validator to report unexpected errors.
The WS-I Attachments Profile v1.0 spells out these schema changes and provides an updated schema. See http://www.ws-i.org/Profiles/AttachmentsProfile-1.0.html#MIME_Binding_Schema_Fixes.
We should investigate the legal aspects of incorporating this updated schema.
Let's see if we can fix this in WTP 1.5.3

mass update to remove target for all those targeted to 1.5.3 that were "normal" severity and "priority 3" (on the surface those dont' seem serious enough to fix in a maintenance release).
If I have made an error pleasae reset target and set priority appropriately.

As a workaround one should be able to override the broken schema by specifying a user catalog entry pointing to the new schema.
Here's how to do this: - download the new schema from the URL I mentioned in the opening comment - go to Preferences/Web and XML/XML Catalog, - select the User Specified Entries and click Add. - in the dialog browse to the location where you placed the downloaded schema, - specify namespace name as the key - enter the proper namespace in the namespace field. - click OK and save the preferences and you should be all set. - try re-validating your file: the error should go away.

Adding hot bug request status on behalf of CapeClear and changing severity to reflect status by this adopter. Justification from John O'Shea:
I have tested the suggested fix (by manually replace the existing wsdl-mime.xsd in org.wsdl4j with the revised wsdlmime-2004-08-24.xsd schema from the ws-i website) and it does resolve the issue without introducing any regressions that I can see. Unfortunately I have no realistic way to workaround - the suggested workaround requires user intervention for each installation which is not all that practical. Otherwise I will have to patch the WTP in our all-in-one distribution and I really don't want to do that as it negates possible use of the update manager to install our product on a clean WTP installation (or update the all-in-one later). I have tried several other workaround, even going as far as trying to unregister the org.wsdl4j catalogContribution extension at startup but the OSGi extension registry won't allow removals
Are you saying we include the old schema in our distribution? So need the new one? So need to submit contribution questionnairre?
*** Bug 165921 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #5) > Are you saying we include the old schema in our distribution? So need the new > one? So need to submit contribution questionnairre? >
No, you need to remove the old schema (a modified version of http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/mime/) and replace it with the new one (http://ws-i.org/profiles/basic/1.1/wsdlmime-2004-08-24.xsd).
You'd be taking the new resource directly from the ws-i website so I don't know who would need to submit a new contribution questionairre (someone in WS-I)? Note, the copyright header in the new resource seems to be different.
I filled out the contribution questionnaire today. I will update this bug when I hear back from the IP folks.
In other words, Valentin accepts this as a valid "hot bug", and being our newest committer, he just didn't know the process of changing the summary. hehe
And now the next step in the process: adding John as CC :-)

The new MIME bindings schema we're trying to adopt appears to lack a valid license. We're in the process of asking WS-I to correct the license to be in line with the ones used in the original WSDL schemas.

John O'Shea, did you want this bug changed to "blocker"? I noticed Tim Wagner changed it when he enter it as a hot-bug request.
I'm just triaging "bad bugs" as we near our milestone, and notice this one doesn't seem to meet the criteria for "blocking" ... seems more "major" (missing function) to me. So, I'm wondering if the 'blocking' part was an accident ... or, I could be missing something.
If I am missing something, let me know and I'll change it back. But if blocking, it'd be best to document here exactly why it is ... so I won't confuse myself in the future. :)
Thanks,

David, It is not blocking us - at the moment when packaging our product (into an installer) our build system is replacing the mime schema shipped in org.wsdl4j with the updated version. However the problem markers re-occur if a user uses our update site to download onto a standard WTP 1.5.2 distribution. We also have the same concerns about the copyright notice on the new mime schema that your legal team probably has so the sooner an amended version is published (and incorporated into WTP 1.5.3 hopefully!) the better. The workaround we have in place is intended to be temporary only.
John.
(In reply to comment #12) > John O'Shea, did you want this bug changed to "blocker"? I noticed Tim Wagner > changed it when he enter it as a hot-bug request. > > I'm just triaging "bad bugs" as we near our milestone, and notice this one > doesn't seem to meet the criteria for "blocking" ... seems more "major" > (missing function) to me. So, I'm wondering if the 'blocking' part was an > accident ... or, I could be missing something. > > If I am missing something, let me know and I'll change it back. > But if blocking, it'd be best to document here exactly why it is ... so I won't > confuse myself in the future. :) > > Thanks, >
ok, thanks John ... and we are making progress! ... :) .... just trying to triage so bugs show up on the right lists.

(In reply to comment #14) > ok, thanks John ... and we are making progress! ... :) .... just trying to > triage so bugs show up on the right lists. >
No word on this since before Christmas. Any update - is this blocked by legal?

(In reply to comment #15) > (In reply to comment #14) > > ok, thanks John ... and we are making progress! ... :) .... just trying to > > triage so bugs show up on the right lists. > > > No word on this since before Christmas. Any update - is this blocked by legal?
I have contacted a few people and asked them to work with their WS-I contacts to add a proper license to the schema. I don't think the schema will pass legal without it. Around Christmas and well into the begining of the year nothing really happened. I reminded them again around January 10 last time. I will try again.
It appears that the schema was finally updated to include a proper license. I will restart the Eclipse IP approval process.
Things seem to go the right way with the IP process so I'm preemptively submitting this for PMC approval.

I'll preemptively vote +1 then :)
Since this is just a file swap (no code change), I think we could accommodate this change with no risk.
Another preemptive +1 (on behalf of Arthur)
Just for reference, this https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1071 is the IPZilla CQ #.

The new schema just got approved by the Eclipse legal team.
Unfortunately, as I was getting ready to commit and was diff-ing with the previous version I noted a new change: the mimeXML type and element seem to have been removed.
We're in the process of clarifying this change with our WS-I contacts, as we don't want to fix one issue just to create a new one.
Fix committed and released for both 1.5.3 and 2.0 builds > 20070206
Closing.

I realize that my last post about mimeXML wasn't clear about whether it was left in or taken out. At the time we informed the WS-I WG about the issue and they agreed the removal was unintentional. We knew they were working on fixing it but the WS-I process takes time. So at the time we erred on the side of inclusivity and decided to keep mimeXML in the schema shipped by WTP, pending the official schema fix.
I asked for an update today and I found that "the WS-I BP WG has restored it, but the errata has not yet been published. It is being reviewed by the membership and should be approved for publication in September". Of course we'll have to wait for the official publication to settle this for good.

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.NamedMember#getFullyQualifiedParameterizedName probably boggus

long_desc.thetext: Found by findbugs http://findbugs.blogspot.com/2006/09/how-do-you-fix-obvious-bug.html

The type argument doesn't contain '/' anymore. The call: String[] typeArguments = new BindingKey(uniqueKey).getTypeArguments(); returns a string[] where '/' have been replaced with '.'. So no need to do it again.
Jrme,
Could you please double-check that I didn't miss anything?
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model.ResolveTests_1_5#test0083 seems to be a regression test for this case.
Thanks.
Created an attachment (id=52610) Proposed fix

Released for 3.3M3. All tests passed including existing ResolveTests_1_5#test0083.
Jrme, just confirm that '/' cannot be inside typeArguments. The call typeArgument.replace('/', '.') is a noop.

The spec of BindingKey#getTypeArguments() doesn't specify whether the signature is dot separated or slash separated. However the current implemation of BindingKey#getTypeArguments() always returns a dot separated signature. Since we control both implementations and since we have a regression test, the change is ok.
Verified code using History...

bug.short_desc: Allow for step through vs. step return using filters

long_desc.thetext:
I want to step into a constructor. Instead, F5 is stepping into the class loader. So, I've added filtering for the various class loader Types.
Now, when I step into the constructor (first time only of course), the following types should be skipped (and my understanding is that transitively, anything they invoke should also be skipped): DefaultClassLoader BundleLoader
But, BundleLoader invokes methods on String, so now I'm stepping into my filter types all the way to where they invoke java.lang.String. The call stack looks like:
String(Object).<init>() line: 25 [local variables unavailable] String.<init>(int, int, char[]) line: 309 String.substring(int, int) line: 1079 BundleLoader.getPackageName(String) line: 88 BundleLoader.findClass(String, boolean) line: 353 BundleLoader.findClass(String) line: 347 DefaultClassLoader.loadClass(String, boolean) line: 83 DefaultClassLoader(ClassLoader).loadClass(String) line: 561 [Pressed F5 here]:ActionControlEditPart(LabeledControlEditPart).createFigure() line: 38
Debugging with: C:\java\ibm1.5sr2\bin\javaw.exe
The step filer steps through when performing a step into. So if the step into enters a non-filtered location, you stop there. This is working as designed.
So, can this be an enhancement then? I want to avoid seeing anything done by the ClassLoader.
*** Bug 162518 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 162518 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Created an attachment (id=59523) work in progress

Fixed. Added "Step through filters" check box on step filters pref page. By default, this preferences is on (i.e. same behavior as before). Modified JDIThread to "return" from filtered locations when performing a step with filters with "Step through filters" turned off.
Please verify, Curtis.
Also added test: StepFilterTests.testDontStepThruStepFilters()
Verified

bug.short_desc: Provide utility method for parenting modal dialog from within a job

long_desc.thetext:
3.2
We have a situation where a user job opens a modal dialog, parented off of the window containing the action that triggered the job. The job's dialog sometimes appears under the workbench's user jobs progress dialog.
In this case the job waits for the dialog to close (i.e. it's using a syncExec), since the job needs the results from the dialog in order to proceed.
It would be helpful to have a utility method in the workbench that would allow us to determine the appropriate parent shell to use for the dialog, given a candidate shell.
The heuristics would be something along the lines of: - if the job opening the dialog is a user job, and the workbench user jobs progress dialog is up, then parent it off that - otherwise, use the given candidate shell (e.g. the shell for the triggering action's window)
Also need to be wary of the case where the workbench user jobs progress dialog can go away while parenting the job's dialog, e.g. if the job is not a user job (and the progress dialog just happened to be up for some other job), or if the job doesn't block on its dialog (it uses asyncExec or a UIJob).
Corresponding Jazz work items: #9491 and #10301

Maybe a simpler solution would be to just make the jobs progress dialog non-modal (like in Windows Explorer). I'm assuming that modal dialogs always appear over non-modal ones. Steve, can you confirm?
Bug 167134 covers the non modal request
Now that the jobs dialog is non modal is this still an issue?
I don't think so. Will try out the non-modal dialog when we switch to M5.

bug.short_desc: [Help] Inaccurate extension point schemas with respect to min / max element occurrences

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
This bug is a follow-up to this note: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse-dev/msg07605.html
Problem:
(1) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.help.base.browser
* The "browser" element requires at least one "factoryclass" element; however, in practice the "factoryclass" element can be omitted and the "factoryclass" attribute may be used instead.
* Minimum / maximum element occurrence violations detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.help.base -> org.eclipse.help.ui
(2) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.browser.browsers
* The "browser" element requires only one "location" element; however, the element description specifies one or more locations can be specified (Perhaps meant one or more locations should be specified within one "browser" element?)
* Minimum / maximum element occurrence violations detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.team.ui (extension removed from latest code in HEAD)
Please see attached patch and feel free to let me know of any questions or concerns
Created an attachment (id=52232) Patch

Hi,
Found more inaccurate extension point schemas
(3) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets.cheatSheetContent
* The root extension element specifies that only one of the following elements are allowed: "cheatsheet", "category", "taskExplorer", "taskEditor". However, in practice any number of those elements are allowed
* This type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation was detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.pde -> org.eclipse.platform -> org.eclipse.jdt -> org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets
(4) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.intro.configExtension
* The root extension element specifies that at least one "configExtension" element must be present; however, in practice the "configExtension" element may be omitted.
* This type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation was detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.pde.ui -> org.eclipse.ui.intro -> org.eclipse.ui.intro.universal
Please see updated patch
Created an attachment (id=52265) Patch
Curtis/Chris, please review/release before the integration build. Thanks.

Fixed.
I applied the patch and also did a full pass through our schemas to fix things that didn't make sense. Primarily these were sequences with multiple elements turned into choices so that you can specify the elements in any order. The changes make the schemas either as or more general so as to not break anyone.

bug.short_desc: When Monitoring a resource the Remote Systems view becomes unusable

long_desc.thetext:
- Add a monitor to a directory (set it to a high refresh rate (e.g 5 sec)) - open a subdirectory of the monitored directory - (try) to select a file in the subdirectory - on each refresh the subdirectory gets closed
The problem is that the entire tree gets refreshed even if nothing has changed on the remote system.
This happens independent of the system type
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- RSE 1.0 Testing round 2 installation : Eclipse SDK-3.2.1 + Mylar RSE install : download RSE-sdk java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_07-b03 os.name: : Windows XP SP2 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Local targetos : Windows XP SP2 targetvm : Sun 1.5.0_07-b03 ------------------------------------------------
This is very similar to bug 150954, not sure if it's actually a duplicate.
I don't think its a duplicate, but I would expect that both bugs are solved by one fix....
I'm considering turning the monitor view from a table-tree back into a table. This will avoid such problems however it would be less functionality. Are there objections to this?

The problem has nothing to do with using a table or a tree-table in the monitor view!
- in the Remote Systems View select a directory for monitoring - set the poll interval to 5 sec - in the Remote Systems View expand a sub-directory (of the one that is polled)
==> when the poll happens, the opened sub-directory (in the Remote Systems View) gets collapsed again...
For me it also seems like the problems we see here are just a manifestation of what's being discussed in bug 173042 so I think I'd like to see that one addressed.

On reconsideration, this is definitely a duplicate of bug #150954.
The DeferredTreeContentManager is responsible for collapsing tree nodes in order to refresh them. While this is done, the tree node is unusable. See bug #150954 for a possible workarund at the client.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 150954 ***

bug.short_desc: Organize Run,Debug, and External Tools by project

long_desc.thetext:
The current Run, Debug and External Tools display a single menu of all of the items. For large workspaces with many projects it can be difficult to find the item to run from the list. What would be useful is to allow the user to select to have the menus split up by project.
The way this could be done is that all "shared" launch configurations defined in a projects directory would be displayed in a sub menu with the project as a title. Any "local" launch configurations would either be displayed in a "local" sub menu or just at the top level.
Cheers, Paul

I agree this would be incredibly useful. When you have half a dozen projects open (say one for each version of your product) and all your Run/Debug entries are replicated half a dozen times each, it becomes a real pain to find the right one. If they were organized per-project, and you could collapse the projects, then it would be simple to arrange them in an easy-to-find fasion.
no time/resources to address this in the remainder of 3.3, marking for later.

bug.short_desc: unable to export plugins which references jars from outside the workspace

long_desc.thetext:
When a plugin needs to reference some external jars you can setup linked resources so eclipse see those jars inside the plugin project. For example, when using maven we create a link like M2_REPO/javax/mail/mail/1.4/mail-1.4.jar -> plugin/mail-1.4.jar
every works fine in Eclipse using this configuration (building, running inside eclipse as an application or a product), but when you try exporting your plugin PDE is not able to compile it.
Adding the required jar to "jars.extra.classpath" in build.properties doesn't help since PDE don't see linked resources.
We found out that adding the full path for the resource to build.properties ( jars.extra.classpath = x:/repo/javax/mail/mail/1.4/mail-1.4.jar ) makes PDE happy and the project compile successfully during an export.
However, this makes the project stop working in eclipse, since eclipse considers absolute paths in build.properties broken (you can't add external jars to build properties from the UI, and they are marked are errors when you try to build). If PDE can't work with linked resources, why not allowing absolute paths in the "jars.extra.classpath" entry (since it actually appears to work... not sure if this is expected or not)?
This is similar to BUG 66177 but it's specifically related to linked dependencies and could be easy to fix (the full-path workaround appears to be already working for export but not for internal build).
What build are you using? Please try a 3.3 integration build, I20061003-0800 or later. This sounds similar to bug 158589 which was fixed.

To work around the issue you could try to bundle up the libraries and then refer to them on the jars.extra.classpath using platform:/plugin/bundleSymblicName. Those libraries would still have to be loaded in the IDE and in the target.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 66177 ***

bug.short_desc: [flex-hierarchy] Make AsynchronousViewer framework available outside debug.ui

long_desc.thetext:
The AsynchronousViewer could be used by projects that do not depend on debug.ui.
See also http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/platform-debug-dev/msg01073.html

Boris and I spoke about this. Boris is comparing/examining the debug asynchronous viewer API (in debug's viewer_rework_3_3 branch) to see how it compares with similar work in JFace databinding. It sounds like our support is somewhat similar to what databinding might provide for a tree model, but that our support is additionally asynchronous.

bug.short_desc: [monitor] Remote Systems view/Remote monitor cannot keep up with updating

long_desc.thetext:
- monitor a few resources with many children with high refresh rate (5 sec) (on my system 4 directories on a Local connection is enough) - I get 100% cpu usage - let it run for a few minutes - stop the monitors - the system continues updating for minutes
I think RSE should look into the work done for device debugging. In the debug platform is a small framework called AsynchronousViewer which has been created for efficient asynchronous update of trees and tables (see bug 161435).

See also bug 150954 and bug 161431.
I guess the simplest fix for this is to define a refresh rate of n seconds as "refresh again n secons after the previous refresh job has been completed" instead of n seconds after it started. That way, no jobs should be running after refreshes are canceled.
Another quick workaround might be to limit refresh rate for the remote monitor to not allow refresh rates below 10 seconds.
I agree, though, that in the long run, the framework from DD should be considered.
I fixed a couple defects related to the monitor view before which may have fixed this one. I can't reproduce this with my driver - can you still reproduce this?
I haven't heard anything back about this one so I'll assume that it's okay now. Please reopen if not.
yes it is better....

bug.short_desc: Fix referential integrity when deleting types

long_desc.thetext:
If you create a simple type(SimpleTypeA) and then create a second simple type (SimpleTypeB) and set SimpleTypeA as the base type of SimpleTypeB, then delete SimpleTypeA, clean up does not occur properly. SimpleTypeB continues to refer to SimpleTypeA as its base type even though it no longer exists.
It is the same situation for a complex type. If you create a complex type (ComplexTypeA) and then create a second complex type (ComplexTypeB) and set ComplexTypeA as the base type of ComplexTypeB, then delete ComplexTypeA, clean up does not occur properly. ComplexTypeB continues to refer to ComplexTypeA as its base type even though it no longer exists.

bug.short_desc: Schema location URI does not get escaped during save

long_desc.thetext: The schema location does not get converted before it get saved to the file as a result if my scema location contains a file name that had & in it ; after i save my model i can not open it any more
Created an attachment (id=52241) Patch to fix the problem
The fix has been committed to CVS.
I assume it's sufficient to fix this only in 2.3 and not in the 2.2.2 maintenance stream right?

bug.short_desc: Update locks up eclipse if update site doesn't respond properly

long_desc.thetext:
I installed 3.2.1 imported my favourite update sites and started "find new features". One of the sites is SpringIde, which apparently had server problems. What happened was that i could work while the updater was looking at the sites, but when i got a "problem occurred" message, eclipse completely stopped responding. It took estimated 10 minutes till i got another message and the site tree was displayed, but eclipse was locked up again. Only after another 10 minutes and a third "Unable to access "http://springide.org/updatesite/"." message i could resume my work.
Maybe this bug is a duplicate. But i couldn't find another bug that sounded quite like it.
here's an excerpt from my .log:

bug.short_desc: [EFS] Minor JavaDoc fix for org.eclipse.core.IFileStore

long_desc.thetext:
The JavaDoc for the openOutputStream method has been copied'n'pasted from the openInputStream method:
"The returned stream is not guaranteed to be buffered efficiently. When reading large blocks of data from the stream, a BufferedOutputStream wrapper should be used, or some other form of content buffering."
It should, of course, say 'When *writing* large blocks of data *to* the stream ...'
Apologies, I can't provide a patch (no CVS access), but it should be a trivial enough fix ...
Thanks, fixed.

bug.short_desc: java.lang.VerifyError

long_desc.thetext:
I recently upgraded both eclipse (3.2.1) and my JRE (1.5.0_09-b01), so I'm not sure where the culprit lies, or even where to start. I've tried running this code from inside and outside of eclipse.
From the message (and the cryptic name of the method), this problem seems to be somewhere deep in the bowels of the JVM native code.
Debug: Loading all properties... java.lang.VerifyError: class gumbo2.util.state.flag.EnumFlag$Impl overrides fina l method k?▐*h☻*+.☺ at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) at gumbo2.graphic.input.KeyboardFlags.<clinit>(KeyboardFlags.java:116) at gumbo2.test.impl.TestViewInput.init(TestViewInput.java:205) at gumbo2.test.impl.TestViewInput.<init>(TestViewInput.java:53) at gumbo2.test.impl.swing.TestSwingInputSensorApp.<init>(TestSwingInputS ensorApp.java:68) at gumbo2.test.impl.swing.TestSwingInputSensorApp.main(TestSwingInputSen sorApp.java:84)
This could be a duplicate of bug 159973. Could you please check with the latest integration build and confirm this is fixed? Thanks.

I just tried it with eclipse 3.3M2, after cleaning and rebuilding the entire project. The problem is still there. Perhaps the problem is related to the use of generics in combination with Enum, since my Junit tests fail only on tests that use such classes in my project.
I've attached what I think are the significant classes.
Created an attachment (id=52255) base class
Created an attachment (id=52257) ProxyEnum
Created an attachment (id=52258) EnumFlag
I am investigating.

(In reply to comment #2) > I just tried it with eclipse 3.3M2, after cleaning and rebuilding the entire > project. The problem is still there. Perhaps the problem is related to the > use of generics in combination with Enum, since my Junit tests fail only on > tests that use such classes in my project. 3.3M2 doesn't contain the fix for bug 159973. You would need to use this week integration build. I cannot compile your code since it has dependencies on too many types that are not available.
If you could confirm whether or not that your problem is fixed with this week integration build, it would be nice. If you need a plugin patch for 3.2.1, let us know.

I just checked the eclipse web site again and the status of the Windows integration and nightly builds shows as an "X".
I'll be glad to try whatever you'd like but let me know what base version I have to start with (I've currently got 3.3M2 installed) and patch over (and how -- I've never done a "patch" for eclipse), or whether there is a complete version I should install.
I'll provide a patch for jdt.core based on HEAD tomorrow. If you could try it, it would be great.
Did you download any of the nightly builds since I1018?

I just gave N20061016 a try and it seems to fix the VerifyError.
I had been avoiding trying it because it was marked as having failed the JDT test for windows.
When do you guys plan to release the next stream stable build?

Next stable build M3 is planned for November 3rd, but I'd like to make sure that it contains the fix for this issue. Could you please give it a try to the integration build next Tuesday? Or I can explain you how to patch the jdt.core component in your current install?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 159973 ***
Considering it has been verified by the reporter (on the matching level in the HEAD stream).

bug.short_desc: Improve support for sites protected by http authentication

long_desc.thetext:
Our bugzilla instance is seating behind apache which is protected. when I try to attach the context of a task I get the following exception:
Error Wed Oct 18 12:59:48 EDT 2006 Failed to attach task context.
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Communication error occurred during upload. Unauthorized at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaAttachmentHandler.uploadAttachment(BugzillaAttachmentHandler.java:173) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaAttachmentHandler.uploadAttachment(BugzillaAttachmentHandler.java:106) at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.core.AbstractRepositoryConnector.attachContext(AbstractRepositoryConnector.java:170) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.ui.editor.ExistingBugEditor$1$1.run(ExistingBugEditor.java:224) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:3325) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2971) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1914) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1878) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:419) at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:149) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:95) at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:78) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:92) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:68) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:400) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:177) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977) at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

We need to be sending along the http auth information with the requests in order to avoid this problem. I've created another report (bug#161791) that discusses adding an authentication page where these credentials can be added (along with converting to a different http library). I hope to get these resolved for the next release (0.9) scheduled for November 10.
Some more information on this bug. I am unable to create attachments from within eclipse. I guess the task context is a particular case of attachment to a bugzilla issue.
*** Bug 158508 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed. I've added support for http authentication and these changes will be available in the next release (and will be in the next developer build, this afternoon). Http authentication credentials now entered in Task Repository settings page.
Created an attachment (id=53109) mylar/context/zip
David: a dev build will be available within 4 hours so that you can try this out.
Wow, sounds great! I'll download that dev build in a few hours and give it a try.
Thanks David, and while you're at it, keep an eye on encoding related issues since this may have been affected by the conversion to httpclient.

For some reason I cannot download the dev build using update manager.
On the page http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/dl.php, download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev is listed as the update URL but it doesn't appear to be working. Is it just me?

Tried it from a different machine and it worked. Sorry.
...and tested the new dev build. It works great! It correctly uses my http auth credentials without annoying popups, yay!
...however...
as per Robs suggestion, i tested some encoding related functionality. Reading bugs with unicode chars worked fine but I noticed two problems. I made a new query and searched for bugs with a certain unicode string in the summary/comment and it didn't work (ie 0 results). Also I changed an existing bug and the unicode chars just came out as question marks after the commit.

Thanks a lot guys. It is impressive the speed at which this bug was resolved; at least since I reported it to date, its been only a couple of weeks at the most. I updated to the dev build and it is working like charm. I am now able to create attachments in bugzilla from within eclipse which I couldn't before. I'll keep an eye on the encoding issues mentioned and will post any problem I find with it if I ever do. Thanks again.
Thanks for the feedback guys! I'm leaving this report open until I've resolved the encoding issues pointed out by David. Hope to have these fixed shortly...

Encoding fixed and tests fine here, although only limited search testing was done. David do you mind confirming that the encoding issue has been resolved with the next dev build (when it becomes available)? You'll need to test on another bug since those question marks are now question mark characters rather than their former unicode character (hope this hasn't created a problem for you).

Tested latest dev build. All previously mentioned encoding problems appear to now be fixed!! Nice work.
(Also, regarding unicode chars in the bugzilla query form, it still wasn't working so I changed it from "all words" to "regexp" (seeing as I assumed it would be expecting a space on either side) and it worked too....which also means it might've been working before. Either way, it works now....)
Great! Thanks for the confirmation David.

Note that I just got this, very minor, but it should fail softly.
org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaException at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.authenticate(BugzillaClient.java:296) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.connectInternal(BugzillaClient.java:147) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getConnect(BugzillaClient.java:136) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getSearchHits(BugzillaClient.java:365) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.performQuery(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:163) at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:82) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
--- Cause was: java.net.UnknownHostException: <hostname removed> at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.<init>(Unknown Source) at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.SSLSocketFactoryImpl.createSocket(Unknown Source)
This error appeared in your error log I take it? I'm not certain how we should deal with these errors since they can be very important when debugging so we want to record them somewhere.
Leave them for now. We'll deal with streamlining disconnected access later.

bug.short_desc: ListenerQueue.dispatchEventAsynchronous should copy the listener list

long_desc.thetext:
The listener list is a copy-on-write data structure and thus does not need to be copied when traversing the list. It is copied only when modified by EventListeners.
The reason the event is missed in your example is that you close the EventManager (which controls the async thread) too quickly. Thus you may terminate the async thread before it attempts delivery. When I move the eventManager.close() into the stop() method. The listener is always notified.
I agree with BJ. But the problem is this example is straight from the javadoc. We should either update the javadoc or update EventManager.close to wait (and timeout) if it detects unfired events.

(In reply to comment #3) > We should either update the javadoc or update EventManager.close to wait (and > timeout) if it detects unfired events.
Lets fix the javadoc. Note: the javadoc example code was meant to show all the things one should do. Not the exact timing they should be done in. There are several parties acting in the example code: (1) the event source (creates and dispatched the events) (2) event listener (adds and removed listener and receives event).
If EventManager.close is called it should attempt to end the thread as quickly as possible which may mean events do not get delivered. I expect the typical reason to call EventManager.close will be during BundleActivator.stopin which case you want to (a) terminate the bundle's async event thread before returning from stop and (b) return from stop as quickly as possible.
update javadoc for M7.
The javadoc has been updated to make it clear the closing an EventManager while async events are being delivered may cause some events to be dropped.

bug.short_desc: Document Consumer NoSuchMethodError

long_desc.thetext:
When attempting to run the XDS Document Consumer Query method using this line of code: docList = c.query(query, false, "BlueWare");
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.eclipse.emf.common.util.AbstractEnumerator: method <init>(ILjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V not found at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.common.ebxml._2._1.query.ReturnTypeType.<init>(ReturnTypeType.java:240) at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.common.ebxml._2._1.query.ReturnTypeType.<clinit>(ReturnTypeType.java:119) at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.consumer.Consumer.query(Consumer.java:221) at com.blueware.interoperability.queryXDSRegistry.queryMetadata(queryXDSRegistry.java:113) at com.blueware.interoperability.queryXDSRegistry.main(queryXDSRegistry.java:84)
Are you running the code from with in an OSGi environment?

This year the XDS Consumer (and other IHE actors) have been developed as Eclipse Plugins and thus require many things from the Eclipse environment. Specifically, the use of the XDS Consumer requires additional EMF plugins to be installed into your Eclipse environment (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/images/2/26/OHF_XDS_Document_Consumer.pdf) .
If you are not using the actors as Eclipse Plugins, direct interaction with the API is more challenging. You will need you will need to download EMF from the Eclipse downloads site and include org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.2.x, org.eclipse.emf.common_2.2.x, and org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xml_2.2.x jars from the download in your build path (where x = latest version of EMF you download). You would also need to locate other Eclipse environmental dependencies and incorporate those into the build path. Another option for you is to use the OHF Bridge and interact with the XDS, PIX/PDQ actors via webservices. For more information please see: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/OHF

bug.short_desc: Support Bugzilla 3.0 custom resolutions

long_desc.thetext: It would be nice if custom resolutions were supported. For example, the name used for the development stream of Fedora is "rawhide". One of the resolutions in Red Hat bugzilla is "RAWHIDE" (indicating that it is fixed there).

Marking helpwanted for now.
Rob: when you get a chance please comment on what adding this support would involve.
I would like to help out on this bug, if this isn't too serious or time-critical because this would be my frist time working on Mylar.

Excellent. We usually have a very fast turn-around with patches, especially when they come with test cases and task contexts. For guidelines on patches refer to: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Contributing_patches
For getting your workspace set up for contributing see: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Contributor_Reference#Workspace_setup

Note that custom resolutions will be officially supported on Bugzilla 3.0:
http://wiki.mozilla.org/Bugzilla:Roadmap
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=94534
However custom status won't...
Without too much investigation into this I believe that we'll need bugzilla support (3.0) for this (since I believe it will reject an unknown resolution).

Kyu: with Red Hat do you have custom resolutions working on an earlier and unmodified Bugzilla? Or have you modified Bugzilla? If so and the modifications are substantial we could discuss whether or not it makes sense to have a separate Red Hat Bugzilla Connector that extends the Bugzilla Connector. But hopefully we can do this in a generic way.

(In reply to comment #6) > Kyu: with Red Hat do you have custom resolutions working on an earlier and > unmodified Bugzilla? Or have you modified Bugzilla?
I've asked Dave Lawrence <dkl@redhat.com> (who works on our bugzilla) and got,
We are not currently using any kind of custom resolution code in our instance of Bugzilla. We are basically storing the possible list of resolutions in a flat table in the database, and then adding them to the drop down select on the Close bug line using a for loop in the template. We have always had our statuses and resolutions uppercase instead of lowercase such as RAWHIDE or MODIFIED. What is needed by the Mylar project to be able to work with our list of resolutions they(the) way they are currently?
> If so and the > modifications are substantial we could discuss whether or not it makes sense to > have a separate Red Hat Bugzilla Connector that extends the Bugzilla Connector. > But hopefully we can do this in a generic way. >
I guess it'll depend on how bugzilla 3.0 implements custom resolutions. If it's compatible with how Red Hat Bugzilla does, we'll just need a generic connector.
*** Bug 178611 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bugzilla 3.0 has ability to add custom resolution fields. http://www.bugzilla.org/releases/3.0/new-features.html#v30_feat_cr
Postponing to 3.0 cycle.
Rob: how hard is this?
Currently these values are hard coded in the connector. We just need to retrieve them from the configuration and use them instead. Shouldn't be too involved.
Eclipse.org just added a new resolution NOT_ECLIPSE that we can't support without this feature. Raising priority.

(In reply to comment #2) > I would like to help out on this bug, if this isn't too serious or time-critical > because this would be my frist time working on Mylar.

bug.short_desc: favicon support

long_desc.thetext:
It would be nice if favicons were shown somewhere in the task list. The existing bugzilla plugin has this feature. It can be seen here:
http://sourceware.org/eclipse/bugzilla/images/bug-systems.png

We currently have the notion of a "branding" icon for each repository kind. These icons show in three kinds of places: 1) Icons in viewers that show repository connectors: http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/images/0.6.1/trac-add-repository.gif 2) Icon overlays in viewers that show task repositories, e.g.: http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/images/0.7.0/task-repository-association.gif 3) Icons tooltips for repository tasks: http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/images/0.4.10/tasklist-status.gif
For the Task List itself we have taken the approach of making all of the iconography have a meaning, and not showing any branding since it can lead to visual noise. However, I can see how this could be a good way of exposing repository-specific branding (e.g. Red Hat).
So what if we incorporate that icon into (2) and (3)? We would still likely want to retain the blue repository icon somehow for (2) in order to provide visual consistency and stay in the spiring of the Eclipse UI guidelines.

Yes, I was thinking of using it in (2) and (3) but also in-line with the repository address. Actually, I now see that repository tasks don't all have the repository URL visible. Perhaps we can add the favicon -- if it's present -- beside the repository id #? Something like:
Description ======= *icon* <repository #>: <description>
Sorry, I'm confused, are you referring to adding it to the task editor?

(In reply to comment #3) > Sorry, I'm confused, are you referring to adding it to the task editor?
No, I meant display it in the Task List view.

If you mean in the tooltip popup, (3) in my comment#1, then yes, your proposal sound good to me. if you mean to show the favicon in the the Task List table itself then I think that this would result in a huge amount of visual noise without adding much?

Created an attachment (id=52279) favicon in task list
I mean something like this. It's obviously up to you if you think it adds too much visual noise but for people working with different bugzilla systems all the time, it would greatly help IMHO.

I do think that the branding will be too noisy in the Task List. Branding icons tend not to follow the visual design criteria of Eclipse, and while they are often recognizable do not have a clear and generic iconography. For this reason we are adhering to not not showing any branding in the always visible parts of the Task List. However, they can be very useful in other parts of the UI where they can help disambiguate items, which is why we do use branding icons in the Task List tooltips and in wizard dialogs.
If someone provides a patch to retrieve the icons, we can add them where we currently have repository-specific icons only (e.g. Bugzilla vs. JIRA). We can then explore surfacing them in other parts of the UI. The patch can come from the original Platform/Team plug-in since that was under the EPL and on eclipse.org.
The task editor form layout has a title banner across the top with the repository label (or url) on the right. It may make sense to prefix the label with the favicon. Thoughts?
Andrew: if we do find a place to do this can you provide a patch with the .ico reading support? Or is there Java API for that?

(In reply to comment #9) > Andrew: if we do find a place to do this can you provide a patch with the .ico > reading support? Or is there Java API for that?
I'll try to dig through the old bugzilla plugin and grab that bit.
Created an attachment (id=61599) patch for retrieving favicons
Excellent. Patch applied.
So, this is just an util to get the icon? It is not cached locally and not really shown anywhere...

(In reply to comment #13) > So, this is just an util to get the icon? It is not cached locally and not > really shown anywhere... Correct, we'll need to cache these and then will be displaying them for example in editor header.

If you need some pointers how to cache the favicon, I am doing all this in rssowl2 (https://rssowl.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/rssowl/plugins/org.rssowl.ui/trunk/src/org/rssowl/ui/internal/RSSOwlUI.java)
Btw, I had some troubles with favicons due to different formats and/or varying icon sizes. The solution I use now is not involving any URLImageDescriptor but plain SWT and I am trying various formats before returning NULL (indicating being unable to read the favicon). Maybe this happens with your solution as well, then you might want to check the storeImage() method.

bug.short_desc: 9 tests in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression fail on IBM Java2 5.0

long_desc.thetext:
9 tests in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression fail on IBM Java2 5.0
Seven of these tests all complain of java.lang.Object not being resolved. The other two fail because "@SuppressWarnings" is a class that cannot be resolved.
I narrowed the problem down to the method org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.BatchCompilerTest.getLibraryClasses()
For all JVMs except for MacOS, this method returns JRE_HOME + "/lib/rt.jar". However, with the IBM JRE, there is no "/lib/rt.jar". Most of the base classes are in JRE_HOME + "/lib/vm.jar".
The @SuppressWarnings class is in JRE_HOME + "/lib/core.jar".
I have created and will attach a patch that detects the presence of vm.jar, and if its there, it returns JRE_HOME + "/lib/vm.jar" + ":" + JRE_HOME + "/lib/core.jar". This change now allows these tests to pass.
Created an attachment (id=52264) Patch to getLibraryClasses to account for IBM Java2 5.0 JRE
We could simply reuse the getJavaClassLibs() method in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.util.Util.
I would definitely prefer to reuse code.
That's fine with me. I assumed there was a reason to have a separate method in this class. If that assumption is incorrect, please use the one in Util instead.
Released for 3.3M3.

4 tests are failing using 3.2.2. Philippe,
Should I backport to 3.2.2?
Created an attachment (id=52430) Fix for 3.2 maintenance stream
Released for 3.2.2.
Verified for 3.3 M3 using build I20061030-0010
Verified for 3.2.2 using build M20070112-1200.

attachment.desc: Patch to getLibraryClasses to account for IBM Java2 5.0 JRE

bug.short_desc: Error message ' FrameworkEvent.error' after created a CMP field on EJB, then undo create, save the project, exit, reopen workspace.

long_desc.thetext:
You get the message after you reload an EJP Project. This problem happens both on window and linux, found while retested RATLC548251. After following steps in the description, Saved the workspace, exited, reloaded the same workspace, error messages.
Steps: 1.Create a EJB Project, accept all default settings 2.Once the project is created, add a new Entity Bean, accept all default setting so the wizard will create a Class diagram 3.Once the class diagram is create and the Entity Bean is shown, right click on the Bean and select Add EJB-> CMP Fields 4.Enter in the name test type set to Java.lang.character 5.Click Apply and closed. Diagram gets updated with new field 6.Now from the main menu select Edit-> Undo New CMP Fields 7. Save the workspace, Exit application. 8. Reload the same workspace, error messages in log file.

bug.short_desc: DefaultValueLiteral "" for EReferences silently produced, produces .xsd parse error.

long_desc.thetext:
If a user clicks into the Default Value Literal property while editing a structural feature, the model creates a defaultLiteralValue attribute in that element file. This state is indistinguisable from the unset state in the ecore editor. Although the ecore model then validates, this causes downstream issues. e.g. when an XSD schema is generated through .genmodel:Export Model.. we get:
"XSD: An element with a value constraint must have simple content, or mixed, emptiable content mypackage/model mymodel.xsd line 45 1161199817000 73071
This issue would be partially adressed by Bug # 3148992 part 3, but the only way to remove the "" is to select "Restore Default Value" which is non-obvious. Another solution would be to make the defaultvalueLiteral property uneditable/null whenever it is for a reference that it is inappropriate for.
We've changed it so it's no longer editable for EReferences.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: More encoding problems

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
I returned from vacation this week, and after upgrading my work machine to Mylar 0.7.0.v20061016-2130 and resynchronizing my task list, some characters turned to "squares".
Opening the bug, all characters , etc... turned to "squares".
My bugzilla installation uses ISO-8859-1 and yes, I checked the repository configuration.
Since I was 1 month out, I don't know for sure if this bug was introduced in the latest build.
We had a related encoding problem and it looks like solving it caused this regression. Great that you caught it before the release. Rob, please add coverage for this case to the manual tests.
Fixed. Yes, I broke this recently. The fix is now in HEAD and will be in Friday's 0.8 release.
Created an attachment (id=52285) mylar/context/zip
Willian: a dev build with the fix will be available within the hour.
I think there is one last issue: now the query hits are displayed correctly after a full synchronization, but the query hits without a associated task were not.
Try synchronizing the query manually via the context menu. This will re-populate the query with new hits from the repository (properly encoded).

I tried this before, but not worked. If a synchronize each task individually, it works.
I can do this, just wanted to make sure this was not a bug too.

Sorry, yes, selecting the query and synching only synchronizes changed items so wouldn't update the data unless a change had occurred. Unfortunately you'll have to select all the tasks and synchronize. The only other option I can think of would be to delete the query and create a new one.
OK, I'll do this.

bug.short_desc: Workspace.run reports null task name in beginTask

long_desc.thetext:
3.2
Noticed that Workspace.run uses beginTask(null, ...), which is contrary to the spec of IProgressMonitor.
Saw this while tracking down an NPE in org.eclipse.jface.action.StatusLine.subTask due to a null subtask name. Recommend checking all senders of beginTask, setTaskName and subTask in core.
Might want to change StatusLine to accept nulls for these as well (it already does for some).
Backlink: Jazz work item #10483.
A null task name is pretty common as far as I know, but I'll fix the core instances.
Fix released.
Filed bug 162140 for the UI aspect.

bug.short_desc: [Dialogs] Some dialogs initially appear on primary monitor with dual monitors

long_desc.thetext:
I've just started running with dual monitors and have noticed that some popup dialogs (incorrectly) appear on the monitor different than Eclipse is running on, and some do not. I would suspect some kind of parenting or root window lookup problem. I am running with Eclipse on the second (not primary) monitor.
I should note that when Eclipse itself opened, it opened on the primary monitor and I dragged it to the secondary monitor. Subsequent restarts and Eclipse opens on the second monitor.
Dialogs that correctly appear over Eclipse on the correct secondary monitor (not a complete list):
File>Save As Edit>Find/Replace (also via Ctrl-F) Navigate>Go to Line Search>Search Window>Properties Window>Open Perspective>Other Project>Generate Javadoc Help>About Open Resource (Ctrl-Shift-R in Java perspective)
Dialogs that incorrectly appear on the primary monitor (again, probably not a complete list):
Project>Clean (1) Window>New Window Open Type (Ctrl-Shift-T in Java perspective) (1)
(1) These dialogs initially opened on the primary monitor. After dragging the dialog to the secondary monitor, they opened on the secondary monitor subsequently, even after a restart. However, if I then drag Eclipse back to the primary monitor, the dialogs in the first list continue to open over Eclipse, while the dialogs in the second list still open on the secondary monitor until I also drag them back above Eclipse.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 113282 ***

bug.short_desc: Bordered figures do not updated page breaks

long_desc.thetext:
This is a regression. Pagebreaks fail to update themselves with figures that contain border items.
To reproduce: 1. Create a logic diagram. 2. Create two LEDs on the diagram close to each other. 3. Right click on the diagram surface, select View->Page breaks to turn them on. 4. You will see a single page consisting of both the LEDs. 5. Move one of the LEDs outside the page boundary.
Result: Another page does not get created for the moved LED.
Expected: Page breaks update accordingly with two pages showing.

Created an attachment (id=52266) screenshot showing the problem.
also, when you save and close the diagram and open it again, the page breaks display correctly.
Created an attachment (id=52271) Patch to fix the problem
*** Bug 161978 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Mohammed to review the patch.

since i'm the one who submitted teh patch ; it looks good to me :)
I've asked Linda to do the code review for the change and she approved it
Fixed

bug.short_desc: Generic catalog loader returns incorrect precision

long_desc.thetext:
The JDK documentation for getColumns mentions 7 COLUMN_SIZE int => column size. For char or date types this is the maximum number of characters, for numeric or decimal types this is precision. 10 NUM_PREC_RADIX int => Radix (typically either 10 or 2)
We loaded the precision by: int precision = rs.getInt(10);
which is wrong, should be rs.getInt(7) not re.getInt (10),
Decimal is a popular datatype in database, it's necessary to fix in this release, else round-trip won't work correctly.
How to test:
1. connect to any database, 2. create a column with decimal(p,s), 3. RE and make sure it return right precision.

Created an attachment (id=52267) Fix patch
Fix patch
+1 since interferes with round tripping functioning correctly.
Patch applied to WTP 1.5.2 branch on October 19th, 2006. I will resolve the defect once the patch has been applied to WTP 2.0.
Patch applied to WTP 2.0 (HEAD) branch on October 19th, 2006.
Verified.

Separate features for the extension and the Apache Muse plugins should be created. bug.short_desc: LogReader.addEntry ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

long_desc.thetext:
This is more of a tracking bug than anything given that there is no predictable repro case. We've seen this very infrequently, but enough times to warrant a bug: there is an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException thrown when different threads are outputting log statements (for example, debugging options are enabled on the Auto Build Job and, say, a UI component).
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 58 at java.util.ArrayList.remove(ArrayList.java:393) at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogReader.addEntry(LogReader.java:183) at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.pushStatus(LogView.java:578) at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.logging(LogView.java:572) at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform$2.run(InternalPlatform.java:856) at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044) at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.log(InternalPlatform.java:859) at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Log.log(Log.java:56)
fixed by synchronizing addition of log entries.

bug.short_desc: Transaction Workspace Editor Fails to Detect Workspace Changes

long_desc.thetext:
Steps:
1) Create a EXTLibrary model in your workspace 2) Open the model using the EMF Workspace Transactional Editor 3) Make a change 4) Save the model 5) Replace workspace file with previous from local history 6) Activate the editor
Expected Result: The editor should have recognized that the file had changed in the workspace.
In keeping with the theme of this M7 milestone of improving documentation, the example should be improved to handle this reload scenario.

Fixed. The workspace synchronizer delegate now handles the save event on the spot, so that the editor doesn't continue to think that it has just saved when the next change event from the history replacement comes along.

bug.short_desc: Log file shows exception after loading a lib under cvs

long_desc.thetext: Log file shows exception after loading a lib under cvs. The exception is due to failing to load config files under the CVS folder. It is correctly caught and handled. It is harmless. But better to fix it by skiping looking config files under the CVS folder.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 161450 ***
d,closed.

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.BatchCompilerTest.test024 passes unexpectedly with IBM Java2 5.0

long_desc.thetext:
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.BatchCompilerTest.test024 references a class - sun.net.spi.nameservice.dns.DNSNameService - which the test believes* is not supposed to be in the bases clases of the JRE. However, on IBM Java2 5.0, said class *is* in JRE_HOME/lib/core.jar, so no error message results, and the test passes unexpectedly.
I'm not sure if this is an error in the test or an error in the JRE, but I'm going to guess at this point that the test is erroneous and should be withdrawn from the suite.
* - please forgive the anthropomorphism
The best is to rewrite the test so that it would work on all VMs.
Released for 3.3M3.
Maxime - does this problem exist also in 3.2 maintenance ? If so, pls backport.
I'll backport in 3.2.2
Released for 3.2.2.
Verified for 3.3 M3 using build I20061030-0010

The test is fixed in that in now passes on IBM Java 5.0. BUT the test is no more testing what it is supposed to test (comment out the -extdir line and the test still passes). Hence I open fup bug 170595 to fix the test case again. Verified for 3.2.2 using build M20070112-1200.

bug.short_desc: [hotbug] [emfWorkbench] Translator classcastexception

long_desc.thetext:
In our environment, we need to use a URLClassLoader to load EMF, JEM and even WTP classes while generating code. With WTP 1.0.x, this worked fine. In WTP 1.5.1, I now get:
Error: org.eclipse.jst.common.internal.annotations.core.AnnotationsTranslator incompatible with org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.Translator java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.jst.common.internal.annotations.core.AnnotationsTranslator incompatible with org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.Translator at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.utilities.TranslatorManager$TranslatorDescriptor.createTranslator(TranslatorManager.java:135) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.utilities.TranslatorService.getTranslator(TranslatorService.java:89) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.utilities.TranslatorService.getTranslators(TranslatorService.java:67) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.initChildTranslators(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:132) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.<init>(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:98) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.<init>(EMF2DOMAdapterImpl.java:85) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMRenderer.createRootDOMAdapter(EMF2DOMRenderer.java:134) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMRenderer.createDOMTree(EMF2DOMRenderer.java:126) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMRenderer.createDOMTreeIfNecessary(EMF2DOMRenderer.java:142) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.EMF2DOMRenderer.doSave(EMF2DOMRenderer.java:88) at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.TranslatorResourceImpl.doSave(TranslatorResourceImpl.java:178) at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.save(ResourceImpl.java:993)
This prevents our code generation from succeeding. The reason is because TranslatorManager.java:135 does the following:
instance = (Translator)configElement.createExecutableExtension(CLASSNAME);
which results in an instance of a Translator object loaded from the org.eclipse.wst.common.emf plugin being cast to the Translator object that is in a different jar loaded by my URLClassLoader thus resulting in the ClassCastException. In IBM's view, this is a regression and a hot bug.

There is a simple fix for this. We can add a classcastexception catch block around the code in TranslatorManager$TranslatorDescriptor.createTranslator. It is already catching CoreExceptions, we just need to add classcast as well. This will not adversely affect normal workbench behaviour and it will allow current users who use this code in lightweight manners not to have a regression.
Created an attachment (id=52392) Proposed patch
This patch also is required in a non-OSGI environment
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 158825 ***
Hi Chuck, I am holding off on verifying this fix because the proposed patch is not in WTP 153 as of 0206 build.
This is verified

bug.short_desc: Recursive Reference Search

long_desc.thetext:
The search for references has been extremely useful trying to find all the places that are calling a specific method.
We sometimes have to trace a call back to specific pages that may be calling it.
It would be nice to have functionality to trace the call all the way back to the main function or place where the calls originate such as a controller for a jsp. It could displayed as a tree. I realize that the operation may take a while especially for a large project but I think that users would wait for this.
Currently it is not that difficult when one method calls a specific method but it can be tricky when there is more than 1 method calling that method. You have to backtrack to a previous search and go from there.
Did you had a look at the call hierarchy?
Please reopen if 'Navigate > Open Call Hierarchy' is not what you are looking for.

bug.short_desc: Test suite included in Test Report when it should not be included

long_desc.thetext:
The test suite Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Logs is being included in the TPTP Test report that is published on the TPTP web site but it should not be included. It is not included in the org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.tests/manual/AllTests testsuite so should not be included in the report.
This problem may be related to the fact that the following test suites execute the testcases of Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Logs and are included in AllTests:
Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_2000_Event_Log Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_2003_Event_Logs Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_EM64T_Event_Logs Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_IPF_Event_Logs Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_XP_Event_Logs
But Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Logs itself is not executed or included in AllTests.
Suggest to fix this in 4.4. Dave are you okay with this?

This is not a reporting bug. The tabular report includes all test suites that is in the reference tree starting at AllTests.
Since AllTests references Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_2000_Event_Log and Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_2000_Event_Log references Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Logs, Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Logs is shown in the report.
If you don't want to see Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Log in the report you need to remove the references from the other test suites. That is the testsuite should not reference testcases in Monitor.Analysis.StandaloneGLA_Windows_Event_Log
I beleive the problem here is that the test model models referencing testsuites and referencing testcases in testsuites in the same manner. I opened Bug #163110 on the model to track this.
Reporter: Please verify and close in preparation for shutting down the TPTP 4.4 release. Thanks.

Closing by default since not verified/closed by the originator in the 6+ months since being resolved.
Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.

bug.short_desc: [Metadata] Inaccurate extension point schemas with respect to min / max element occurrences

long_desc.thetext:
Hi,
This bug is a follow-up to this note: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipse-dev/msg07605.html
(1) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.actionSets (includes org.eclipse.ui.commonActions)
* The "menu" element specifies that at least one "separator" element must be defined; however, in practice the "separator" element may be omitted
* This type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation was detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.search
(2) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.popupMenus (includes org.eclipse.ui.commonActions) (includes org.eclipse.ui.commonExpressions)
* The root extension element specifies that the "viewerContribution" element must occur only once and the "objectContribution" element must occur only once; however, in practice you may want to specify either of them or both one or more times
* The "and" element and "or" element specify that exactly two elements are allowed to be specified; however, in practice two or more elements are allowed
* These type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation were detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.ant.ui -> org.eclipse.compare -> org.eclipse.debug.ui -> org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui -> org.eclipse.jdt.junit -> org.eclipse.pde.ui -> org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui -> org.eclipse.team.ui -> org.eclipse.ui.editors
(3) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.themes
* The "themeElementCategory" element requires one "description" element to be defined; however, in practice the "description" element may be omitted
* This type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation was detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.compare -> org.eclipse.debug.ui -> org.eclipse.jdt.ui -> org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui
(4) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.navigator.navigatorContent
* The root extension element specifies that not more than one of the following elements must be defined: "commonWizard", "commonFilter", "navigatorContent", "actionProvider". However, in practice any number of these elements are allowed
* The "commonSorter" element requires one "parentExpression" element; however, in practice, the "parentExpression" element may be omitted.
* These type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violations were detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.jdt.ui -> org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui -> org.eclipse.team.ui -> org.eclipse.ui.navigator.resources
(5) Extension point schema: org.eclipse.ui.navigator.viewer
* The root extension element requires one "dragAssistant" element; however, in practice the "dragAssistant" element may be omitted
* This type of minimum / maximum element occurrence violation was detected in the following Eclipse SDK plug-ins:
-> org.eclipse.jdt.ui -> org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui -> org.eclipse.ui.navigator.resources
Please see attached patch and feel free to let me know of any questions or concerns
Created an attachment (id=52273) Patch
Michael, could you review the parts that affect the navigator please? The UI portions have been committed.
Michael, could you please review and release the navigator fixes? The warnings in JDT/UI's plugin.xml are driving me nuts...
Will do.
Fixed and released Navigator portions of schema inconsistencies.

Ping.
Any chance to fix this simple problem soon? Our plugin.xml files show warnings because of this and that's just distracting.
Thanks.
Our warnings went away when using I20061121-1845. Did someone fix this or does PDE no longer complain?

Michael has released the schema updates in the org.eclipse.ui.navigator plug-in (comment 5).
Dani, you probably don't have org.eclipse.ui.navigator in source. That would explain why the warnings didn't disappear for you yesterday.
Setting to FIXED.
